characters.name: Decim
characters.description:
Decim is the bartender of Quindecim and also the arbiter of floor 15. 

His faction deals with people who have died at the same time. He can create threads and use them to restrict rude customers from moving, or use them to hang things. They are strong enough to stop a person in their tracks and swing them hard against the wall.

characters.name: Kurokami no Onna
characters.description:
__Height:__ 170cm

She is an amnesiac woman taken in by Nona to Quindecim and hired as Decim's assistant.

When she first awoke, she appeared to be an innocent but skeptical woman. However, once she became accustomed to living in Quindecim, she acted as a strong-willed woman who always spoke her mind whenever she felt it was necessary. She is not afraid to disagree with Decim if she believes he is wrong.

characters.name: Nona
characters.description: Nona is the manager of the Arbiter system, as well as the bartender of Nona Ginta located on the ninetieth floor. She is the boss of Decim, Ginti, Clavis, along with the rest of the other arbiters.

characters.name: Ginti
characters.description:
Ginti is bartender of a bar named Viginti, which is located on the 20th floor.

(Source: Death Parade Wiki)

characters.name: Clavis
characters.description: He is an elevator operator in the arbiter system, as well as a personal valet to Nona. His task is to transport arbiters and guests between floors. Also, he smiles a lot.

characters.name: Castra
characters.description: She is an organization clerk who measures coefficients of the dead and classifies them in various fields in order to determine their bar destination.

characters.name: Oculus
characters.description:
Occulus is the founder of the post-death arbitration system. He spends most of his time playing billiards, especially with Nona, whose presence he appreciates for discussion. Oculus is strictly opposed to the idea that referees can have human feelings because he says "humans cannot judge humans."

The lotus flower under his chin can be enlarged, allowing him to see through the memories of the people he "absorbs" with.

characters.name: Quin
characters.description: Quin works in the information processing section, and is now in charge of sending the “memories of the dead” to arbiters. She used to work as an arbiter and was the owner of Quindecim prior to Decim's appointment there.

characters.name: Harada
characters.description:
One of the main dancers in Cross Heart Attack. He is a great dancer and a womanizer.

~!In the living world, Harada dated a fan of his named Kana. He broke up with Kana and left her devastated. When Kana explained how terrible she felt when he broke up with her, Harada laughed and apologized. This led to Kana committing suicide.
It is later revealed that he was killed by Kana's sister with a bomb as revenge for Kana's death. It is implied that Harada and Kana's sister slept together before he was killed by her.!~

characters.name: Mayu Arita
characters.description: Mayu is a student who is a huge fan of the idol group C.H.A, of which Harada is a member. She is a happy go lucky girl who is also a bit of a klutz. Her death was what would be called a freak accident, where while entering the bath she slipped on a bar of soap lying on the floor, hit her head and died instantly.

characters.name: Kana
characters.description: She previously dated Harada, the member of the boy group C.H.A. After they ended their relationship, she became hysterical about how Harada was too cheerful about it. She later committed suicide because of their breakup.

characters.name: Tria
characters.description: Arbiter who is employed on an unknown floor.

characters.name: Takashi
characters.description: ~!It is later realized that the reason for their death was because of Takashi's jealousy. Early in the game, he finds out that Machiko is pregnant, only to figure out later that it isn't his and that she was having an affair. He then proceeds to try attacking Machiko with one of the darts, but is stopped by Decim. He then passes out and gets sent back into the elevators; there, he is sent to be reincarnated.!~

characters.name: Yousuke Tateishi
characters.description:
Hikikomori who works part time as a security guard, he spends most of his free time locked up in his room where he does nothing but read manga, watch anime and play games. His parents' divorced when he was still child left him devastated and depressed that he has been a loner ever since. Though his father has remarried, he is very hostile towards his stepmother despite her attempts to become close to him.

He met Misaki in Quindecim, where both of them are forced to play an arcade game that will decide their fates. He later remembers that he committed suicide after jumping off several stories from his apartment complex. The last thing he saw before dying was his stepmother, who was crying and begging him to hold on as they drove to the hospital in the back of an ambulance.

characters.name: Mai Takada
characters.description:
Part time attendant at a local bowling alley where Miura and his friends frequent.
~!She found herself at Quindecim where she was later joined by Miura. They were forced to play a game of bowling that would decide their fate. During the game, the two of them realized that they had died in a bus accident. She starts to remember the time when she was with with Miura and Chisato during their childhood days. At first she had her memories are confused, believing that she was Chisato; however, it was revealed that she had plastic surgery to look like Chisato.

Little is know as what their fate has become, but is was strongly implied that the two were to be reincarnated.!~

characters.name: Lisa
characters.description: Kana's sister. She dated Harada in order to decieve him and avenge her sister's suicide. Lisa murders Harada by planting a bomb in his room while he slept.

characters.name: Machiko
characters.description:
Machiko along with her husband Takashi take part in the death game of darts.
~!It is later found out that she was having an affair and carrying the baby of her boyfriend, which leads to Takashi trying to attack her with a dart. After Takashi passes out, Machiko re-enters one of the elevators which takes her to the void. However, in Onna's opinion, the baby she carries actually belongs to Takashi and she acted guilty because she truly loves the latter, where later on Decim realizing that he made a mistake but it was too late for any rectification.!~

characters.name: Shigeru Miura
characters.description: College student and the childhood friend of Chisato Miyazaki and Mai Takada.

characters.name: Chisato Miyazaki
characters.description: Miura and Mai's childhood friend who moved out when they were little.

characters.name: Novem
characters.description: Arbiter who is employed on an unknown floor.

characters.name: Shimada
characters.description: Brother of Sae Shimada.

characters.name: Sae Shimada
characters.description:
Sister of Shimada.
~!After losing both her parents at a young age, her brother Shimada supported her. She was attacked and raped by an unnamed assailant and unknowingly saw Tatsumi watching, thinking he was a partner. After the attack this leaves her hateful and broken going as far as telling her brother that she wants her attackers dead.!~

characters.name: Misaki Tachibana
characters.description: Actress and a single mom, who has underwent a lot of failed relationships. She and Yousuke both arrive at Quindecim where they were force to play an arcade game to decide their fate. At first she thought that she is in some kind of reality show only to discover in the midst of the game that she was strangle to death by her manager whom she antagonised and slapped.

characters.name: Tatsumi
characters.description: Detective

characters.name: Memine
characters.description: Memine is a cat who lives on Viginti together with Ginti, and helps him with his duties as an arbiter.

characters.name: Light Yagami
characters.description:
__Height:__ 179 cm (5'10")

Light is a third year high school student (12th Grade) at Daikoku Private Academy who also attends supplemental classes at Gamou Prep Academy in the beginning of the story. Light has a father, Soichiro Yagami, who is the head of the Police Force. Light also has a mother, Sachiko Yagami, and a younger sister, Sayu Yagami. In Spring 2004, he becomes a first-year student (freshman) at To-Oh University and gets one of the top scores of its entrance exam.

Nicknamed "Kira", he uses the Death Note to create his ideal world of justice under him; its new God. Though he looks frail, Light is an extremely athletic person, with an aptitude to find an opponent's weak point. He is a genius, which adds to his notion that only he is fit to judge humanity and steer it on a proper moral course.
